Part lI   Dialogue
Dialogue 1
                                                     Bowels
Nurse:  What brings you here?
Patient: I have some trouble with my bowel elimination1.
Nurse:  How often do you have your bowels opened2?
Patient: It' s hard to say. It' s irregular.
Nurse:  Is this a life-long habit3?
Patient: No, it isn't. I used to have bowel elimination once a day. But it changed two months ago.
Nurse:  What do the motions look like.'?
Patient: They are dry hard balls.
Nurse:  What about the color.'? Has it changed.'?
Patient: Dark-brown. I think the color is darker than ever before.
Nurse:  Have you ever seen any blood in your motions?
Patient: No.
Nurse:  Have you noticed an unpleasant smell?
Patient: Yes, rather offensive.
Nurse:  Do you get pain, during or after passing your motions?
Patient: Of course I have, especially during my bowel elimination.
Nurse:  Do you take laxatives.'?
Patient: Yes, I took laxatives last week. However, they didn't help.
Nurse:  Have you lost any weight.'?
Patient: No.
Nurse:  All right, we would like to have your stool examined. Will you please give us a specimen?
Patient: Yes, I will try.

Notes
1. I have trouble with my bowel elimination. 我大便有点困难   
2. How often do you have your bowels open? 你多久排一次大便  ?
3. a life-long habit: 长期的习惯
Dialogue 2
                                                   Peptic Ulcer
Nurse:  Well, what' s your trouble?
Patient: Two hours after eating I get pain and when ! bend I get it1.
Nurse:   Have you had any pain like this before?
Patient: Yes.
Nurse:  What kind of pain is it?
Patient: It is sort of burns.
Nurse:  How long have you had this pain?
Patient: I' ve had it off and on for the past two years2, but it' s never been this bad before.
Nurse:   Does the pain stay in one place?
Patient: Yes, it does.
Nurse:  Where is that?
Patient: Right here.
Nurse:   Does the pain get worse when you get excited and worried about things?
Patient: Why, yes, it does.
Nurse:   How do you get relief?
Patient: Normally a glass or two of milk will quiet things down3.
Nurse:   Do you have the taste of sour liquid in your mouth?
Patient: Yes, terrible.
Nurse:   If you drink something hot, does it affect you?
Patient: I feel it burning as it goes down.
Nurse:   Did any particular food upset you?
Patient: Yes, I was fasting for three days for my religion and then I went to my sister's and had
           some fish and chips.
Nurse:   Do you regularly fast?
Patient: Twice a year for my religion.
